bobby.engine.bobengine

Class GameObject

  • java.lang.Object
    • bobby.engine.bobengine.GameObject
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    NumberDisplay

    public class GameObject
extends java.lang.Object
    Super class for all the game objects in the game.
    Version:
    alpha
    Author:
    Ben

    • Constructor Detail

      • GameObject

        public GameObject(int id,
                  Room containingRoom)
        Initialization. Requires a unique Id number and the room containing this GameObject.
        Parameters:
        id - - ID number
        containingRoom - - Room that this object is in.

    • Method Detail

      • giveCollisionBox

        public void giveCollisionBox(double x1,
                             double y1,
                             double x2,
                             double y2)
        Give this GameObject a collision box. Each coordinate has a range of 0 to 1. 0 is the left/top edge of the object and 1 is the right/bottom edge.
        Parameters:
        x1 - - Left edge of the collision box
        y1 - - Top edge
        x2 - - Right edge
        y2 - - Bottom edge

      • getNumColBoxes

        public int getNumColBoxes()
        Returns the number of collision boxes this object has.

      • getGraphicID

        public int getGraphicID()
        Returns this object's graphic's ID number

      • setGraphic

        public void setGraphic(Graphic graphicSheet,
                       int x,
                       int y,
                       int height,
                       int width,
                       int frames)
        Set graphic information for this object using pixel coordinates. Should only be used when there is only one drawable folder.

        NOTE: if a graphic has more than one frame, they should all be the same size and be stacked vertically in the same image file.
        Parameters:
        graphicSheet - - The graphic sheet to use.
        x - - The x coordinate of the graphic on the sheet, in pixels.
        y - - The y coordinate of the graphic on the sheet, in pixels.
        height - - The height of a single frame of the graphic on the sheet, in pixels.
        width - - The width of a single frame of the graphic on the sheet, in pixels.
        frames - - The number of frames the graphic has.

      • setPreciseGraphic

        public void setPreciseGraphic(Graphic graphicSheet,
                              float x,
                              float y,
                              float height,
                              float width,
                              int frames)
        Set graphic information for this object with precise values for x, y, width, height. Use this when there is more than one drawable folder.
        Parameters:
        graphicSheet - - The graphic sheet to use.
        x - - The x coordinate of the graphic on the sheet, from 0 to 1.
        y - - The y coordinate of the graphic on the sheet, from 0 to 1.
        height - - The height of a single frame of the graphic on the sheet, from 0 to 1.
        width - - The width of a single frame of the graphic on the sheet, from 0 to 1.
        frames - - The number of frames the graphic has.

      • setGraphic

        public void setGraphic(Graphic graphic,
                       int frames)
        Set the graphic for this object with a specific number of frames. For better performance when using many graphics, put multiple graphics onto a single graphic sheet and use setGraphic(Graphic graphic, int x, int y, ...) or setPreciseGraphic(...).
        Parameters:
        graphic - - The graphic to use. Should only have one image on it. Should not be a sheet of graphics.
        frames - - The number of frames this graphic has.

      • updatePosition

        public void updatePosition(double x,
                           double y)
        Move this object to position (x, y). It is better to change the x and y properties of this object instead. Your call to this function will likely be overriden.
        Parameters:
        x -
        y -

      • animate

        public void animate(int FPS,
                    int start,
                    int end)
        Animates this GameObject. Will loop through start frame to end frame at a speed of FPS frames per second.
        Parameters:
        FPS - - the speed of the animation in frames per second
        start - - the first frame of the animation.
        end - - the last frame of the animation.

      • getVertices

        public float[] getVertices()
        Gets the vertex data for drawing this object. Can be overriden for advanced purposes but be sure to also create getGraphic() and getIndices() overrides that match your getVertices() function.
        Returns:
        This object's vertices.

      • getGraphic

        public float[] getGraphic()
        Gets the graphic coordinate data for drawing this object. Can be overriden for advanced purposes but be sure to also create getVertices() and getIndices() overrides that match your getGraphic() function.
        Returns:
        This object's graphic coordinates.

      • getIndices

        public int getIndices()
        Gets the number of indices for drawing this object. Can be overriden for advanced purposes but be sure to also create getVertices() and getGraphic() overrides that match your getIndices() function.
        Returns:
        The number of indices needed to draw this object.

      • concatenate

        public float[] concatenate(float[] a,
                           float[] b)
        Returns an array containing the contents of a and b. Useful for rendering more than one quad with one game object.
        Parameters:
        a -
        b -
        Returns:
        {a + b}

      • getRoom

        public Room getRoom()
        Returns this game object's containing room.

      • getView

        public BobView getView()
        Returns the BobView containing this GameObject

      • getActivity

        public Activity getActivity()
        Returns the Activity containing the BobView that contains this GameObject.

      • getRatioX

        public double getRatioX()
        Returns the screen width correction ratio for dealing with different size screens. This ratio is based off of the initial orientation of the device when the BobView is initialized!

      • getRatioY

        public double getRatioY()
        Returns the screen height correction ratio for dealing with different size screens. This ratio is based off of the initial orientation of the device when the BobView is initialized!

      • getTouch

        public Touch getTouch()
        Returns the Touch touch listener for the BobView containing this GameObject.

      • update

        public void update(double deltaTime)
        Update event that happens every frame. Super class method handles position updating, frame changing, and animation. You should override the step() method for game logic.
        Parameters:
        deltaTime -

      • step

        public void step(double deltaTime)
        Event that happens every frame. Can be overridden.
        Parameters:
        deltaTime - - [Time the last frame took]/[60 FPS]
        Will be 1 if the game is running at 60FPS, > 1 if the game is running slow, and < 1 if the game is running fast.

      • newpress

        public void newpress(int index)
        Touch screen newpress event. Can be overridden, no need to called super.newpress().

      • released

        public void released(int index)
        Touch screen released event. Can be overriden, no need to call super.released().

      • onScreen

        public boolean onScreen()
        Determines if this object is on the screen or beyond the edge of the screen.
        Returns:
        True if this object is on the screen or false if the object is beyond the screen's bounds.
